instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message:
Corrosion on left part of keyboard connector and nowhere else. Testing with known-good functioning trackpad and keyboard.
• Boots normally
• Restored 3.42V on pin 4 of keyboard connector.
• I have no trackpad or keyboard.
• 3.3V on pin 27 and 12.6V on pin 1 of J4802.
• <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is at 3.3V. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> is present - power to <CHIP>U4820</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> is good. Everything matches up with a good board.
• Force touch click turns on when computer is turned on.
• Keyboard/trackpad do nothing in drive boot menu.

These are the exact same measurements as [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/13894-no-trackpad-or-keyboard-on-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/url]

Any ideas for what could be causing this? Apparently something is going on with this board when it gets hit by liquid in that area. Any help would be greatly appreciated. I'm really hoping to avoid starting a collection of booting 2015 Retina boards with no keyboard/trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
[SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
[SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Did you replace the trackpad cable??

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: I'm actually not using that top case for testing. The one I'm using works perfectly with a working board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Im out of ideas, lets wait Duke..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: 5V present on pin 25? Corroded pin on connector is likely just as much as that the cable on your test case has died. TP clicks once power is on?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Yes, 5V is on pin 25 of J4802. And yes, trackpad clicks as soon as the board gets power.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Inspect connector for corroded pins. Diode mode all the pins of the flat cable at the trackpad end to rule out a bad connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Connector looks flawless. I can put my good board in and the cables/trackpad/keyboard all work normally. This model has an odd system where the keyboard doesn't work without a trackpad present - unlike the old pros, and similar to the Airs except the keyboard doesn't run through the trackpad. I'm wondering if the interaction that allows the keyboard to work is somehow being hindered by something in the trackpad circuit.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Did you compare all pins on the connector on diode mode with a known good board? Best to do this at the flat cable on the TP side so you know the connector is good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Another booting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad and keyboard
threads.message: Good idea. It got me to recheck all of the diode measurements and I realized I missed <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CS_CONN_L</SIGNAL> being slightly off (around 0.910 instead of 0.788). Led me to a bad <TRANSISTOR>Q4960</TRANSISTOR>. Board works fully now. Thanks.
